content:
I think it's helping me to come to terms with the fact that my friend is really gone, and that I'll never see them again. It's hard to accept, but it's also kind of freeing in a way. I've been holding onto the hope that somehow, someway, they'll come back, but impermanence is like a reminder that that's not possible. It's allowed me to start letting go of that hope and focus on the memories I have of them, and the impact they had on my life.

It's also making me think about my relationships with the people who are still in my life. I've been taking them for granted, assuming that they'll always be there. But impermanence is a reminder that that's not true. It's making me want to appreciate them more, and not take our time together for granted.

I'm still processing it all, but I think it's going to take some time. Do you think it's normal to
